alert.note: Alert for Bear Lake Valley; Bear River Range; Blackfoot Mountains; Caribou Range; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Marsh and Arbon Highlands (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 11 at 4:08AM MST until January 13 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 AM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 9 inches, except 10 to 20 inches on ridge tops and elevations above passes. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Marsh/Arbon Highlands, Franklin/Eastern Oneida Region, Bear River Range, Bear Lake Valley, Blackfoot Mountains, and Caribou Range, including but not limited to Inkom, McCammon, Downey, Lava Hot Springs, Malad, Preston, Thatcher, Emigration Summit, St. Charles, Montpelier, Georgetown, Grace, Soda Springs, Henry, Bone, Wayan, and Swan Valley. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 5 AM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing and drifting snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning and evening commute.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by visiting 511.idaho.gov.
